conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves backward.

Shadow positions and lengths depend on the angle and distance of the light source from the objects.
When the light source moves backward, the angle at which light rays hit the objects changes, affecting both the position and size of the shadows.
As the light source moves backward, the shadows will shift closer to the objects because the light rays come in at a shallower angle.
The shadows will become smaller as the light source moves farther away, decreasing the spread of light rays.
The direction of shadow movement will be towards the objects, retracting closer as the light source moves backward.
Shadow A moves closer to the glass and becomes smaller.
Shadow B moves closer to the rock and becomes smaller.
Shadow C moves closer to the cylinder and becomes smaller.
Shadow D moves closer to the paper plane and becomes smaller.
The final answer is that shadows A, B, C, and D will shift closer to their respective objects and decrease in size.
